comments.requestOpenOrder: Request to open a deal was sent

comments.noInformationCloseOrder: After ${s} s. Closing information not received.

topic.newNotification: Read the notification in your robot panel.
topic.updateApp:
Dear user! A new version of PocketOptionRobot is available! If you have not automatically updated the extension to version ${version}, then go to the extensions control panel. Next, turn on Developer mode (the button in the upper right corner) and click UPDATE.
You can also delete and re-download the extension.

001.title: Global Upgrade PocketOptionRobot
001.description: We are pleased to announce the long-awaited robot update!
001.text:
We are pleased to announce the long-awaited robot update!
You're in for :
  • Extended extension functionality
  • New indicators
  • Flexible strategy settings
  • Detailed instructions for users
  • Built-in service for managing Tether (USDT) coin on the TRON network (TRC-20)

002.title: Account not licensed ${uid}
002.description: Your account ${uid} registered off the project link
002.text:
Your account ${uid} registered off the project link.
To get an unlimited license to use the robot, register an account on the Pocket Option platform by reference of our project, or using the form below.

003.title: Updating the PocketOptionRobot. Version 7.0.7
003.description: In PocketOptionRobot, an asset exclusion feature has been added at a new signal.
003.text:
Dear traders! The extension has been updated to version 7.0.7. We have added a setting for excluding the asset of the last martingale step when using a new strategy signal.
Make sure that you have the current version of the extension installed, then reconfigure the martingale steps in your strategies if this setting is relevant to you.

If you have not automatically updated the extension to version 7.0.7, then go to the extensions control panel. Next, turn on Developer mode (the button in the upper right corner) and click UPDATE.
You can also delete and re-download the extension.
Successful trading!

004.title: Updating the PocketOptionRobot. Version 7.0.9
004.description: The capabilities of the Levels indicator have been expanded.
004.text:
Dear traders! We have updated the PocketOptionRobot extension to version 7.0.9. We have expanded the functionality of the "Levels" indicator by adding the "The initial bar for determining the level" parameter to it

Make sure that you have the current version of the extension installed, then reconfigure the martingale steps in your strategies if this setting is relevant to you.

If you have not automatically updated the extension to version 7.0.9, then go to the extensions control panel. Next, turn on Developer mode (the button in the upper right corner) and click UPDATE.
You can also delete and re-download the extension.
Successful trading!

005.title: Updating the PocketOptionRobot. Version 7.1.1
005.text:
Dear user! We have updated the PocketOptionRobot extension to version 7.1.1
  • Added conditions for opening deals for the levels indicator
  • Added export/import of strategies
  • The ability to add a user comment to the indicator
  • The function of displaying the trading result of the strategy in the general panel
  • Added Persian language

If your extension has not been automatically updated to version 7.1.1, then go to extensions control panel. Next, turn on Developer mode (the button in the upper right corner) and click UPDATE.
You can also delete and re-download the extension.
Successful trading!

006.title: Launching the Meta Trader Signal Service
006.description: We are launching a signal translation service from Meta Trader to Pocket Option via PocketOptionRobot
006.text:
Tomorrow we will launch a service for broadcasting signals from Meta Trader 5 to Pocket Option.
üî• If you use it, then join chat.
We are conducting all discussions there. Have a good trade!üìàüéØ

007.title: PocketOptionRobot Update. Version 7.1.3
007.text:
Dear users! We have updated the extension to version 7.1.3. Two indicators based on MACD have been added: MACD lines and MACD histogram. We have also placed 2 corresponding strategy templates in the market.
If your extension has not been automatically updated to version 7.1.3, then go to the extension control panel. Then enable developer mode (button in the upper right corner) and click UPDATE.
You can also delete and re-download the extension.
Happy trading!

008.title: Settings for the PocketOptionRobot Strategy
008.text:
üî•Dear users! We have created a separate strategy group with settings for PocketOptionRobot:@pocketoption_settings

üíæ To download the strategy settings, right-click on your strategy and then select the "IMPORT" option and specify the path to the settings file.json

009.title: Updating the PocketOptionRobot. Version 7.1.6
009.description: Adding the Parabolic SAR indicator and the basic strategy template.
009.text:
Dear users!
We have updated the extension to version 7.1.6. The new version adds the Parabolic SAR indicator and the basic strategy template.
üìäüìâ Have a good trading day!

If your extension has not been automatically updated to version 7.1.6, then go to the extensions control panel. Next, turn on developer mode (the button in the upper-right corner) and click UPDATE.
You can also delete and re-download the extension.

010.title: Updating the PocketOptionRobot. Version 7.1.7
010.description: Adding the "Candle Model" indicator and a new marketing strategy
010.text:
üî• Dear users! We have updated the PocketOptionRobot extension to version 7.1.7. Now, when creating your strategy, you can add the "Candle Patterns" indicator, and the "Absorption" strategy template has also been added to the market

If your extension has not been automatically updated to version 7.1.7, then go to the extensions control panel. Next, turn on developer mode (the button in the upper-right corner) and click UPDATE.
You can also delete and re-download the extension.

description.descAffiliate:
The developer is a member of the Pocket Option platform affiliate program.
Free use of PocketOptionRobot is possible when registering on the Pocket Option platform using the developer's affiliate link

valRsi>tpl.long: B-Indicator line is in the overbought zone

valRsi<btl.long: A-Indicator line is in the oversold zone

valRsi<tpl && valRsi>btl.long: C-Indicator line is in a moderate zone

checkPrice<downLineBb.long: A-Price is below the lower line of the indicator

checkPrice>upLineBb.long: B-Price is above the upper line of the indicator

checkPrice>downLineBb && checkPrice<upLi.long: C-Price is between the upper and lower line

lastdir=='up'.long: A-First candle being tested closed upwards ‚Üë

lastdir=='down'.long: B-First candle being tested closed downward ‚Üì

check_price<down_line.long: A-Price is below the lower line of the indicator

check_price>up_line.long: B-Price is above the upper line of the indicator

check_price>down_line && check_price<up_.long: C-Price is between the upper and lower line

prise>min_level.long: D-Price is above the support level

ticks[1]<max_level && ticks[0]>max_level.long: <hr class="basic line"/>E-The intersection of the resistance level from the bottom up. *Allowed only for bar 0 (current)

ticks[1]>max_level && ticks[0]<max_level.long: F-The intersection of the resistance level from top to bottom. *Allowed only for bar 0 (current)

ticks[1]<min_level && ticks[0]>min_level.long: G-The intersection of the support level from the bottom up. *Allowed only for bar 0 (current)

ticks[1]>min_level && ticks[0]<min_level.long: H-The intersection of the support level from top to bottom. *Allowed only for bar 0 (current)

_d>_t && _k>_t && _k>_d.long: A-Both stochastic lines K, D are in the overbought zone; the value of K is higher than the value of D

_d>_t && _k>_t && _k<_d.long: B-Both stochastic lines K, D are in the overbought zone; the value of K is lower than the value of D

_d > _b && _d < _t && _k > _b && _k < _t.long: C-Both stochastic lines K, D are in the moderate zone; the value of K is higher than the value of D
D-Both stochastic lines K, D are in the moderate zone; the value of K is below the value of D

_d<_b && _k<_b && _k>_d.long: E-Both stochastic lines K, D are in the oversold zone; the value of K is higher than the value of D

_d<_b && _k<_b && _k<_d.long: F-Both stochastic lines K, D are in the oversold zone; the value of K is below the value of D

_k>_t.long: G-Fast stochastic K line is in the overbought zone

_k<_t && _k>_b.long: H-Fast stochastic K line is in the moderate zone

_k<_b.long: I-Fast stochastic K line is in the oversold zone

_d>_t.long: J-Slow stochastic D line is in the overbought zone

_d<_t && _d>_b.long: K-Slow stochastic D line is in the moderate zone

_d<_b.long: L-Slow stochastic D line is in the oversold zone

onema>toma.long: A-Value of average ‚Ññ1 is higher than the value of average ‚Ññ2

onema<toma.long: B-Value of average ‚Ññ1  is lower than the value of average ‚Ññ2

valCci>tpl.long: B-Indicator line is in the overbought zone

valCci<btl.long: A-Indicator line is in the oversold zone

valCci<tpl && valCci>btl.long: C-Indicator line is in a moderate zone

valueMacdLine[0]>valueSignalLine[0].long: A-MACD value is higher than Signal value

valueMacdLine[0]>valueSignalLine[0]&&val.long: B-MACD value is above Signal value, both lines are above zero
C-MACD value is above Signal value, both lines are below zero

valueMacdLine[0]<valueSignalLine[0].long: <hr class="basic"/>D-MACD value is below Signal value

valueMacdLine[0]<valueSignalLine[0]&&val.long: E-MACD value is below Signal value, both lines are above zero
F-MACD value is below Signal value, both lines are below zero

valueMacdLine[1]>valueSignalLine[1]&&val.long: <hr class="basic line"/>K-MACD crosses Signal from top to bottom *Valid only for bar 0 (current)
L-MACD crosses Signal from top to bottom, both lines are above zero *Valid only for bar 0 (current)
M-MACD crosses Signal from top to bottom, both lines are below zero *Valid only for bar 0 (current)

valueMacdLine[1]<valueSignalLine[1]&&val.long: N-MACD crosses Signal from bottom to top *Valid only for bar 0 (current)
O-MACD crosses Signal from bottom to top, both lines are above zero *Valid only for bar 0 (current)
P-MACD crosses Signal from bottom to top, both lines are below zero *Valid only for bar 0 (current)

macdHistogramm[indparms['checkBar']]['li.long: B-Histogram indicator is UP and value above zero
C-Histogram indicator is UP and value below zero
E-Histogram indicator DOWN and value above zero
F-Histogram indicator DOWN and value below zero

macdHistogramm[indparms['checkBar']]['va.long: <hr class="basic"/>G-The indicator value is higher than the indicator value on the previous bar
H-The indicator value is lower than the indicator value on the previous bar

positionSarUp.long: A-The location of the Parabolic SAR above the price chart

positionSarDown.long: B-The location of the Parabolic SAR under the price chart

canUp&highLast.long: A-A growth candle, the body of the candle is larger than the body of the previous one

canUp&lowLast.long: B-A growth candle, the body of the candle is smaller than the body of the previous one

canDown&highLast.long: C-Drop candle, the body of the candle is larger than the body of the previous one

valRsi>tpl.long: B-Indicator line is in the overbought zone

description.bbRsi:
Combined trading strategy based on two popular indicators. The main one is Bollinger lines, RSI is used as a confirming one. At the opening of a new candle (bar), the robot analyzes the closing price of the previous candle and the value of the RSI indicator relative to the oversold level 30 and overbought level 70. ${spanUp}The robot will open a bullish trade if the closing price of the previous candle is below the lower Bollinger Band and the confirming RSI indicator is in the oversold zone, i.e. below the signal level of 30 ${spanDown}The robot will open a bearish trade if the closing price of the previous candle is above the upper Bollinger line and the confirming RSI indicator is in the overbought zone, i.e. above the signal level 70
*In the robot settings, the current candle (bar) has a conditional ticker 0, the previous candle has a ticker -1.
description.indicatorRsi:
A popular trading strategy based on the famous RSI* indicator. In this strategy, the robot checks the value of the RSI indicator at the opening of a new candle (bar). RSI levels with values of 70 and 30 (overbought and oversold levels) act as signal levels for opening trades. ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade on the rise, if at the opening of a new candle indicator RSI will be in the oversold zone, ie below the signal level 30. ${spanDown}The robot will open a downward trade if at the opening of a new candle the RSI indicator is in the overbought zone, i.e. above the signal level 70.
*RSI (Relative Strength Index) is a classic oscillator, which is built based on calculating the relative rate of change in asset quotes over a given period.
description.bbLine:
A very effective trading strategy used in all financial markets, based on the famous Bollinger Lines indicator*. At the opening of a new candle (bar), the robot analyzes the closing price of the previous candle ${spanUp}The robot will open a deal on the upside, if the closing price of the previous candle will be below the lower Bollinger line.${spanDown}The robot will open a deal on the downside, if the closing price of the previous candle will be above the upper Bollinger line.
*Bollinger lines (Bollinger bands) - a tool for technical analysis of financial markets, reflecting the current deviations in the price of an asset. The indicator is calculated based on the standard deviation of a simple moving average.
description.contrataka: A trading strategy that is advisable to use specifically on binary options, including during news releases. In this strategy, the robot uses a simple algorithm and bets on the rebound of the price at the formation of a signal candle, the minimum size of which is 100 pips ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade on the upside, as soon as the signal candle of the fall is formed, the minimum size of which is 100 pips ${spanDown}The robot will open a trade on the downside, as soon as the signal candle of growth is formed, the minimum size of which is 100 pips
description.enterStochZones:
A trading strategy, the main idea of which is to determine the moment of entry of the fast stochastic %K line into the overbought (above the 80 level) or oversold (below the 20 level) zone ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade on the upside as soon as the fast stochastic %K line enters the oversold zone (below the signal level of 20) ${spanDown}The robot will open a trade on the downside as soon as the fast stochastic %K line enters the overbought zone (above the signal level of 80)
*Stochastic oscillator (stochastic oscillator) - an indicator of technical analysis, which shows the position of the current price relative to the range of prices for a certain period in the past. It is measured in percent.
description.threeCandlesToTrend:
A simple trading strategy suitable for trading in the trending market. In this strategy, the robot tracks a combination of 3 consecutive candles (bars) of the same direction, and opens a trade to continue the price movement in the same direction. ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade on the upside as soon as 3 consecutive up candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle ${spanDown}The robot will open a trade on the downside as soon as 3 consecutive down candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle
*In the settings of the robot, the current candle (bar) has a conditional ticker 0, the previous candle respectively ticker -1.
description.threeCandlesAntiTrand:
A simple trading strategy suitable for calm markets. In this strategy the robot tracks a combination of 3 consecutive candles (bars) of the same direction and opens a trade for the opposite price movement, i.e. reversal. ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade on the upside as soon as 3 consecutive down candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle ${spanDown}The robot will open a trade on the downside as soon as 3 consecutive up candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle
*In the settings of the robot, the current candle (bar) has a conditional ticker 0, the previous candle respectively ticker -1
description.intersectionMa:
A classic trading strategy for all financial markets, built on the crossover of moving averages MA*. In this strategy, the robot monitors the location of the moving averages MA (5) and MA (20) on each tick, that is, simple moving averages with periods of 5 and 20. A deal is opened when these moving averages cross. ${spanUp} The robot will open a bullish trade as soon as the moving average MA (5) crosses the moving average MA (20) from bottom to top ${spanDown} The robot will open a downside trade as soon as the moving average MA (5) crosses the moving average MA (20) from top to bottom
*Moving Average (MA) is a technical analysis tool that is a line connecting points on the price chart , constructed by calculating the average price value over the last few bars.
description.keltnerChannel:
An effective trading strategy used in all financial markets, based on the Keltner Channel indicator*.In this strategy, the robot analyzes the chart of the asset price relative to the indicator bands at the opening of each new candle (bar). upper band of the indicator
*Keltner channel is a technical indicator consisting of two bands above and below the moving average of the price indicator, the width of which is determined as a proportion of the average price change for the period.
description.levelHit:
One of the most popular trading strategies among traders, which is based on support and resistance levels. In this strategy, the robot determines local highs and lows of the price on a certain time period*, which is set by the trader in the robot settings ${spanUp}The robot will open an up trade as soon as the asset price on a certain tick becomes below the support level (local minimum for the period) ${spanDown}The robot will open a down trade as soon as the asset price on a certain tick becomes above the resistance level (local maximum for the period)
* The ¬´period¬ª parameter in the robot is the number of candlesticks to determine levels.
description.penetrationLevel:
One of the popular momentum strategies for intraday trading based on support and resistance levels. In this strategy, the robot determines local highs and lows of the price on a certain time period*, which is set by the trader in the robot settings ${spanUp}The robot will open an up trade as soon as the asset price on a certain tick becomes above the resistance level (local maximum for the period) ${spanDown}The robot will open a down trade as soon as the asset price on a certain tick becomes below the support level (local minimum for the period)
* The ¬´period¬ª parameter in the robot is the number of candles to determine the levels.
description.stochIntersection:
A popular trading strategy based on the crossing of stochastic lines*. In this strategy the robot tracks on each tick the location of the fast (%K) and slow (%D) stochastic lines when both lines are in overbought or oversold zones ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade to the upside as soon as the fast stochastic line %K crosses the slow stochastic line %D from bottom to top, and the crossing of the lines will occur in the oversold zone (below the signal level 20) ${spanDown}The robot will open a down trade as soon as the fast stochastic line %K crosses the slow stochastic line %D from above downwards, and the crossing of the lines will occur in the overbought zone (above the signal level 80).
*Stochastic oscillator (stochastic oscillator) is an indicator of technical analysis, which shows the position of the current price relative to the range of prices for a certain period in the past. It is measured in percent.
description.four–°andlesToTrend:
A simple trading strategy suitable for trading in the trending market. In this strategy, the robot tracks a combination of 4 consecutive candles (bars) of the same direction, and opens a trade to continue the price movement in the same direction. ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade on the upside as soon as 4 consecutive up candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle ${spanDown}The robot will open a trade on the downside as soon as 4 consecutive down candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle
*In the settings of the robot, the current candle (bar) has a conditional ticker 0, the previous candle respectively ticker -1.
description.four–°andlesAntiTrend:
A simple trading strategy suitable for calm markets. In this strategy, the robot tracks a combination of 4 consecutive candles (bars) of the same direction and opens a trade for the opposite price movement, i.e. for reversal. ${spanUp}The robot will open an up trade as soon as 4 consecutive down candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle ${spanDown}The robot will open a down trade as soon as 4 consecutive up candles are formed with the set minimum size of each candle
*In the robot settings, the current candle (bar) has a conditional ticker 0, the previous candle respectively ticker -1
description.stochUturn:
A trading strategy, the main idea of which is to determine the moment. The robot will open the deal –Ω–∞ment when the fast stochastic %K line leaves overbought (above the 80 level) or oversold (below the 20 level) zones, which may mean a short-term trend change (reversal). ${spanUp} up as soon as the fast stochastic %K line leaves the oversold zone, i.e. crosses the signal level 20 from bottom to top ${spanDown}The robot will open a down trade as soon as the fast stochastic %K line leaves the overbought zone, i.e. crosses the signal level 80 from the top downwards.
*Stochastic oscillator (stochastic oscillator) - an indicator of technical analysis, which shows the position of the current price relative to the range of prices for a certain period in the past. Measured as a percentage.
description.commodityChannelIndex: A popular trading strategy based on the CCI* indicator. In this strategy, the robot checks the value of the CCI indicator at the opening of a new candle (bar).CCI levels with values of 100 and -100 (overbought and oversold levels) are the signal levels for opening trades. ${spanUp}The robot will open a trade on the rise, if at the opening of a new candle indicator CCI will be in the oversold zone, i.e. below the signal level -100..${spanDown}The robot will open a down trade if at the opening of a new candle CCI indicator will be in the overbought zone, i.e. above the signal level of 100. *CCI (Commodity Channel Index) - technical indicator based on the analysis of the current change in price deviation from its average value for a certain period
description.macdIntersection:
A widely applicable trading strategy for all financial markets, built on the intersection of moving averages MACD*. In this strategy, the robot tracks the intersection of the main MACD line with the signal line (Signal) on the current candle (bar) ${spanUp}The robot will open a bullish deal as soon as the main MACD line crosses the Signal line from bottom to top ${spanDown}The robot will open a bearish deal as soon as the main MACD line crosses the Signal line from top to bottom

*MACD (Moving Average Convergence/Divergence) - stands for . One of the most popular indicators, which is quite simple, but at the same time, very versatile. This tool can be used both as a trend indicator (since it is based on moving averages) and as an oscillator. The indicator consists of three components: MACD line, signal line, histogram.
description.macdHistogram:
A trading strategy based on the MACD histogram. Recommended for use as an additional indicator. In this algorithm, the robot tracks the direction (color) of the MACD histogram bars ${spanUp}The robot will open a bullish trade at the opening of a new bar: if bar -1 was UP (green), and bar -2 was DOWN (red). ${spanDown}The robot will open a bearish trade at the opening of a new bar: if bar -1 was DOWN (red), and bar -2 was UP (green).

*MACD (Moving Average Convergence/Divergence) - stands for . One of the most popular indicators, which is quite simple, but at the same time, very versatile. This tool can be used both as a trend indicator (since it is based on moving averages) and as an oscillator. The indicator consists of three components: the MACD line, the signal line, and the histogram.
description.parabolicSAR:
A trading strategy for all financial markets based on the well-known Parabolic SAR* indicator.In this strategy, it tracks the change in the position of the indicator points relative to the price chart at the opening of a new bar. ${spanUp}The robot will open an upward trade as soon as an indicator point is formed below the price chart at the opening of a new bar after at least 5 consecutive indicator points located above the price chart, which may indicate a trend change from bearish to bullish ${spanDown}The robot will open a downgrade deal as soon as an indicator point is formed above the price chart at the opening of a new bar after at least 5 consecutive indicator points located below the price chart, what could indicate a trend change from bullish to bearish

*The Parabolic SAR technical indicator is designed to analyze trending markets. The indicator is based on a price chart. In its meaning, this indicator is similar to the moving average, with the only difference that the Parabolic SAR moves with great acceleration and can change its position relative to the price. On the "bullish trend" (Up Trend), the indicator is below prices, on the "Bearish Trend" (Down Trend) it is higher.
description.takeover:
A candle combination trading strategy that is popular with candle analysis enthusiasts.
The strategy is based on the "Candle Patterns" indicator built into the robot. In this strategy, the robot tracks a combination of 2 consecutive candlesticks (bars) ${spanUp}The robot will open a raise deal as soon as a growth candle is formed, the body size of which is larger than the size of the previous drop candle ${spanDown}The robot will open a downside deal as soon as a drop candle is formed, the body size of which is larger than the size of the previous growth candle

*In the robot's settings, the current candle (bar) has a conditional ticker of 0, and the previous candle has a corresponding ticker of -1.

categories.historyLong: History - section with detailed information about each trade and martingale series.

pages.whatIsPocketOptionRobot:
PocketOptionRobot ‚Äì a unique application for automated trading on the Pocket Option digital options platform. The robot is designed as an extension to the browser Google Chrome and has no analogues.
The robot is RESOLVED for use on the platform, it does not use prohibited algorithms.
With the help of the robot, a trader will be able to:
pages.openAutomaticTransactions: Open automatic trades using ready-made PocketOptionRobot basic strategies available in the ¬´Store¬ª section of the extension.
pages.createYourStrategies: Create your own strategies, including using strategy templates from the Store.
pages.useRobotFreeRegisterAccount: To use the robot for free, register an account on the Pocket Option platform to link of our project, or by using the form below.

registrationForm.approval: I read and agreed to the agreement: Public Offer Agreement

pages.whatAlreadyRegisteredPocketOption:
What to do if you are already registered on Pocket Option and would like to use the robot?
There are 2 options for free robot connection, both are allowed on Pocket Option:
pages.contactSupportRequestId: You can contact the Pocket Option support team with a request to assign your existing account to a partner with an id ${affcode} (our affiliate code). If you have not previously been assigned to another partner, this option will work for you!
pages.deleteOldAccount: If your account is already linked to another partner, the broker is allowed to delete the old account and register a new one to link our project. All you'll need is a different e-mail. Next, you will be quickly verified and can use the robot! We recommend cleaning your browser before registering a new account.
pages.thisTheMainMenuBlock: This is the main menu block, where you can choose a suitable strategy with the necessary settings or create your own strategy using a set of indicators built into the robot
pages.toSwitchStrategySettingMode: To enter the strategy settings mode, click on it with the left mouse button or, by right-clicking on it, select the ¬´Settings¬ª context menu item. You will be presented with 4 consecutive blocks with settings
pages.toLaunchStrategySliderOnPosition: To start the strategy, drag the slider to the ON position, or you can right-click the mouse and select the context menu item ¬´Activate¬ª
pages.toStopStrategySliderOffPosition: To disable the strategy, drag the slider to the OFF position, or you can right-click to select the ¬´Stop¬ªcontext menu item
pages.youCreateStrategyBasedSettings: You can create a strategy according to your own settings. To do this, click on the ¬´Create¬ª button
pages.youDeleteStrategy: You can delete a strategy by selecting the ¬´Delete¬ªcontext menu item
pages.youCreateCopyStrategy: You can create a copy of the strategy by selecting the ¬´Create a copy¬ª context menu item
pages.loggingPlatformAccountLicenseUnlimited: If you have registered an account to link our project, then after authorization on the platform at the top of the screen you will see the information panel ¬´Robot Status¬ª, where it is indicated that the robot is connected and the license is unlimited.
pages.allAssetsPlatformAvailable: All assets on the platform are available for selection. For user convenience, assets are categorized
pages.selectDesiredAssetSimplyClick: To select the desired asset, simply click on it and it will be added to the ¬´Selected¬ª category. A ¬´Select All¬ª function is also available.
pages.convenienceSearchOption: For convenience, it is possible to search for an asset by its name.
pages.addNewIndicatorStrategy: To add a new indicator to the strategy, press ¬´+¬ª against the corresponding indicator. By adding an additional indicator, you are actually creating your own new strategy.
pages.checkingCondition: Verify the condition. Here select a new bar or a new tick. If we select a new tick, the robot will check the indicator value continuously. If we select a new bar, the robot checks the indicator value at the moment when a new candle is born (i.e. on the first tick).
pages.typePriceIndicatorCalculation: Type of indicator calculation price. Any indicator can be based on the opening, closing, minimum or maximum prices of candlesticks (bars). Most often in technical analysis the indicators are built by closing prices.
pages.timeframeIndicatorCalculation: Timeframe. The robot offers a choice from 5-second (5s) to daily timeframe (1D) for analyzed charts.
pages.barIndicatorCalculation: At which bar to check the value. If we analyze the indicator value on the current candle (bar), we should set the value ¬´0¬ª, if on the previous formed candle, we set the value -1, etc. ( -2, -3, -4 ....)
pages.periodIndicatorCalculation: Indicator period. Each technical analysis indicator has a period - the number of prices (number of bars) that will be included in the calculation of the current indicator value
pages.generalInformationIcators:
When using basic strategy templates from the Store, you see in this block already ready templates for setting indicators. First come the settings of the main indicator, then the settings of the additional indicator, if it is provided by the strategy algorithm. At your discretion you can edit all available indicator settings: conditions of signal checking, type of price calculation, timeframe, period, deviation, etc.. You can also add new indicators, located on the left side as a vertical list.
IMPORTANT: For the correct setting of your strategy, you must understand the principle of operation of indicators and conditions for opening trades according to the algorithm of the strategy!
pages.robotRegulations: An important block of strategy settings. Here you set the mode of operation, trading time of the robot, minimum % of return of the asset, expiration, rate, number of simultaneous trades, stop loss and take profit. You can use ready-made basic strategy settings from the Market, but it is advisable to set your own settings based on the current market analysis, news background, your account balance and risk appetite. You should understand that ready-made basic strategies are templates that you must customize for yourself.
pages.modeRobotOperating: Operating mode. You can choose to trade automatically, or you can choose to submit signals.
pages.timeFromRobotOperating:
Operating time. Set the desired run time when the robot will trade.
If 00:00 - 00:00 is selected, the robot will run continuously.
pages.minProfitRobotOperating: Min. % of yield. Specify the minimum yield on the asset at which the robot can open trades.
pages.expirationRobotOperating: Expiration (sec). Duration of the deal is specified.
pages.betRobotOperating: Rate. Specify the amount for which the deal will be opened.
pages.maxBetsRobotOperating: Simultaneous trades. Specify the maximum number of open trades for the strategy.
pages.slRobotOperating: Stop Loss. This is the amount of loss upon reaching which the robot will stop trading on the strategy. When 0 is specified, the setting is ignored
pages.tpRobotOperating: Take Profit. This is the amount of profit, upon reaching which the robot will stop trading on the strategy. When 0 is specified, the setting is ignored
pages.robotMartingale: A very important block of strategy settings responsible for risk control and trade management after an unsuccessful trade on the starting signal. Trading using the martingale method is popular and effective for trading digital options, but it also involves a higher level of risk. The robot has very flexible martingale series settings, which makes trading more profitable and risk controlled. At each step of the martingale series, the trader can choose the expiration, the direction of the trade, and the method of calculating the martingale coefficient. A block of settings is also available, which determines the robot's actions when the return on the asset decreases, the asset is unavailable or the expiration expires.
pages.addStepMartingale: Adding a martingale step. New step by default copies the settings of the previous step (if any).
pages.robotActionDecreaseProfit: Customizing the robot's action if the return on an asset decreases.
pages.robotActionDisabledAsset: Customize the robot's action if the asset becomes unavailable on the platform.
pages.robotMartinExpiration: You can set a different expiration for each martingale step.
pages.robotActionDisabledExpiration: Customizing the robot action if the specified expiration is not available on the asset.
pages.robotMartinDirection: For each martingale step there is a choice of trade direction available.
pages.robotMartinAutoRatio: The robot can automatically calculate the amount of the trade at each step to take the trading series to a profit equal to the starting bet. Either the robot can increase the previous bet by the selected odds.
pages.detailedViewTransactionInformation: To view information on a deal in detail, just click on the corresponding line in the history.The detailed information on the trade also contains a button to go to the information about the martingale series (if any) and a button to go to the Journal of the extreme strategy launch, which contains step-by-step information about each action of the robot within the launched strategy
pages.detailedMartinSeries: You can analyze trades by martingale series by setting the appropriate filter in the ¬´Grouping¬ª column.This information is very useful if you trade on several assets at the same time .
pages.detailedShop: A set of ready-made basic strategies for both beginners and experienced traders. Each strategy has a description of the algorithm of opening trades and is based on popular trading indicators. The list of strategies in the Store will be periodically updated with new ones. You can always add any strategy from the store to your active list of used strategies and it will appear in the Strategies section.
pages.detailLogbook: The log of an extreme strategy launch reflects step-by-step information about each robot action within the launched strategy. This detailed approach provides the trader with comprehensive information on trades, reasons for refusal to open trades in the presence of a signal and so on.
pages.detailWalletDesc: MyTether - integrated into PocketOptionRobot extension service for managing Tether crypto coin (USDT) in TRON network (TRC-20) on the most favorable conditions for the user. The transaction is carried out at the expense of MyTether resources, which allows its users to save up to 70% of the commission in the TRON network. MyTether belongs to the group of non-custodial cryptocurrency wallets, which allows users to own and control their private keys. Private keys and cid-phrases are stored exclusively in the extension and are not shared online in any way with third parties. Users can also use the service together with TronLink web wallet and Ledger cold hardware wallet. Transaction fees are paid with the internal coin of the TFC service. The price of this coin is fixed and is 1 USDT.
pages.toStartWallet: In order to start using the wallet, set a strong password for login. You will then have several options available to you to add accounts.
pages.generateAccount: Generate an account - the wallet will be created on the Tron network and you will be presented with cid phrases.
pages.attentionGenerateAccount: Warning: Sid-phrases are key information for accessing your funds. Copy them down and keep them in a safe place that is not accessible to you. They cannot be recovered if lost. In case of loss of cid-phrases access to your cryptocurrencies will be lost forever. The Service does not have access to this information and is not able to remind or restore it to you.
pages.importAccount: Import Account - You can import your wallet with a cid-phrase or private key.
pages.createPair: Create a pair - MyTether offers the option to pair the wallet with Tron Link wallets and Ledger hardware wallets. In this use case, all private information is stored in the wallets you pair with, and transaction signing is done in their interfaces.
pages.createSendTx: To transfer a coin, hover over it on the main wallet panel, after which the "Send" and "Receive" buttons will become available. Before sending coins, make sure you have enough TFC coins to charge transaction fees.To purchase TFC coins, use the exchange button by clicking on the "Exchange" button, also located on the main wallet panel .
pages.addIndicatorApi:
To receive an external signal from the TradingView platform, add the "External Signal" indicator to your PocketOptionRobot strategy. After adding an External Signal, you will need to specify the robot's Server in the "Network Bridge" parameter, as well as copy the unique identifier for its further binding to the Trading View. On the TradingView platform, you will need to create a new alert for your strategy, for which it must be pre-created on the TradingView platform. In the "Notifications" tab of your alert, you need to enter the address of our robot's server in the "webhook URL" field: https://pocketoption.expert/tradingview / Next, after the slash (/), you need to add a unique identifier that you previously copied in the PocketOptionRobot extension when you added an external signal.
Next, go to the "Settings" tab of the alert and enter the action and asset parameters in the "Message" field, according to your strategy without spaces.
In its generalized simplest form, it looks like
pages.howBroadcastTradingView: How do I broadcast a signal based on a strategy created in TradingView to Pocket Option?
pages.attentionTradingView: ATTENTION: You need knowledge of the TradingView functionality to create a strategy and correctly set up an alert! We do not teach you how to work with the TradingView platform, but provide you with a service for transmitting a signal to Pocket Option!
pages.assetIdInfo: Information on assets in the platform

links.tg: TG/VIBER support and promo code distribution
